scenario_title: Single-Event Sabotage via Mass Hate Email Broadcast

why.details: A disgruntled employee, frustrated by perceived unfair treatment or lack of recognition, decided to publicly expose fabricated or exaggerated issues in an all-staff email to damage the company's internal trust and external reputation.

how.description: Composed and sent a broadcast email to all employees via the internal email system containing fabricated allegations about unethical company practices and leadership failures, aiming to provoke distrust and lower morale.
how.procedure: Insider uses their legitimate email access to all-staff lists to send disruptive communications, misrepresenting facts and encouraging internal distrust; uses personal knowledge of internal grievances to amplify impact.
observable_evidence: Mass email sent to all staff not typical of sender's role
Email content referencing internal issues or blaming leadership
High-volume employee responses or complaint tickets shortly after broadcast
how.impact: Damage to internal trust, employee morale, and brand reputation; potential escalation of internal conflict and subsequent turnover.

how.description: Leveraged valid email credentials to perform the broadcast without tripping standard content-moderation controls (e.g., by crafting it to appear as status update or internal announcement).
how.procedure: Insider already possesses legitimate credentials or obtains them; uses them to bypass spam filters and appear as normal internal communication.
observable_evidence: Email send-activity from a user account with valid credentials
Time of send unusual for role (e.g., non-hr user sending company-wide broadcast)
No external login anomalies since using valid credentials
